intro: Deinbollia longiacuminata, commonly known as the long-acuminate bladderpod, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its small, elongated, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a pod that dehisces to release seeds, a common trait in the Brassicaceae family. Deinbollia longiacuminata is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments.
